sentences.english: Why do they always accuse us so brutally?
sentences.chinese: 为什么他们这么粗暴地指责我们？

sentences.english: It was rather high-handed to punish the child for the accident.
sentences.chinese: 因意外事件而惩罚孩子是相当粗暴的做法。

sentences.english: The newest version of the outrageously fun, smash-hit board game, Cranium?
sentences.chinese: 粗暴乐趣的新版本，捣毁击中了棋，头盖骨？

sentences.english: It saddened her to watch him speak rudely like that.
sentences.chinese: 看到他那样粗暴无礼地说话，她感到十分痛心。

sentences.english: Though he looks surly , he has his heart in the right place.
sentences.chinese: 他表面上虽然显得粗暴，可是心眼儿却不错。

sentences.english: But he was rough and harsh-spoken and difficult when he was drinking.
sentences.chinese: 可是他一喝了酒，就态度粗暴，出口伤人，性子别扭。

sentences.english: In horse, the careless or rough passage of a stomach tube may result in bleeding from the nose.
sentences.chinese: 对马不小心或粗暴插入胃管可导致鼻出血。

sentences.english: A bit of the Bohemian rebel, a bit of the noble savage.
sentences.chinese: 带着一点波希米亚式的反叛，还有一点贵族气的粗暴。

sentences.english: I cried, thinking him deaf, yet highly disgusted at his rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 我喊着，以为他聋了，但是十分厌恶他的粗暴无礼。

sentences.english: Harry began to reveal himself as more than merely crude.
sentences.chinese: 哈里开始暴露出他的本相不仅仅是粗暴而已。

sentences.english: Right now, he needed to get to Stephanie, her surly attitude be damned.
sentences.chinese: 目前，他必须找到丝苔妮，让她粗暴的态度见鬼去。

sentences.english: And anti-American finger-pointing will only make it harder to extract the climate-change legislation from the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 粗暴的反美只会使参议院更加难以通过气候变化法案。

sentences.english: The Afghans had been rough with him, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，这些阿富汗人当时对他很是粗暴。

sentences.english: There exists also a rubberized version for particularly rugged applications.
sentences.chinese: 也有包胶版本供特别粗暴的应用情况。

sentences.english: I can't ignore your rudeness any longer.
sentences.chinese: 对于你的粗暴无礼，我再也不能不闻不问了。

sentences.english: We'll not take your rudeness lying down.
sentences.chinese: 我们对你的粗暴无礼是不会善罢甘休的。

definition: the Way of the Hegemon/abbr. for 霸王之道/despotic rule/rule by might/evil as opposed to the Way of the King 王道/overbearing/tyranny/(of liquor, medicine etc) strong/potent
